Job Title: Loan Servicing Processor II
Job Description:
Job Description

Commercial Loan Processor, Loan Processing Services The Commercial Loan Processor is responsible for the set-up, maintenance, and processing functions associated primarily with commercial loans. Has contact with lenders, lending assistants, closers, relationship mangers, group managers, administrative staff, and other various departments or people as needed to ensure accuracy of borrow accounts.
Position Competencies Successful incumbents possess Comerica's Core Values of: Customer-Centricity, Collaboration, Excellence and Integrity. This candidate will also exhibit a high focus on Listening, Problem Solving, Drive for Results, Business Acumen and Prioritization.
Position Responsibilities

Independently analyze loan transactions for proper format, completeness of information, and verify that documentation meets Comerica's credit policy and CLS procedures.
Process various types of transactions related to servicing commercial loans such as setting up new loans, renewals, payments, and rate changes; credits and debits checking and savings accounts, repricing's, advances, GL Cashier checks, Wires, fees, DDA transactions, and other miscellaneous transactions.
Reconcile loan balances and transactions.
Maintains and set up commercial loan accounts using the AFS system, while meeting production standards with a high degree of accuracy.
Contact lenders, lending assistants, closers, relationship mangers, group managers, agent banks, administrative staff, and other various departments or people as needed to ensure accuracy of borrow accounts

Relocation Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.
Travel Travel is not required of this position.

Qualifications


High School Diploma OR General Education Diploma (G.E.D.) 
3 years of experience in a bank, financial services or office environment
2 years of accounting OR cash/expense balancing experience 
2 years of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Outlook, Word and Excel
1 year loan servicing experience
1 year telephone AND face to face customer service experience 
1 year experience using a calculator OR 10 key

Job Title: Principal  Engineer   Mobile API Development  Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description

Principal Engineer
The Principal Engineer role will provide engineering and architecture support for complex system management activities related to system software, hardware, performance, problem determination or resource management requiring communication and coordination with vendors, technicians, clients, and management. It will provide technical input to management decision making in the area of software, hardware, and performance. Its responsibilities include: defining networking requirements; performing detailed analysis of various projects and requests; developing designs for projects that have medium to high complexity; formulating procedures; monitoring key performance indicators; and implementing advanced business solutions. This role may also integrate solutions or build via DevOps depending on the maturity of the organization and/or product.
Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, have strong inter-personal and communication skills, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, and ability to multi-task and have strong organizational skills.
The role requires the candidate to be able to mentor new developers and take a hands on role in development as necessary. The position is with an Agile team and experience with test driven development/paired programming will be an asset,
Responsibilities:Design & Methodology

Investigate & propose a strategic fit solution across server platform infrastructures.
Work closely with Business Units, Application teams, infrastructure areas & Vendors to identity, review & evaluate the solution requirements.
Investigate & propose strategic fits for Virtualization, Consolidation & Rationalization solution opportunities within the infrastructure or business. Propose changes to the technical architecture & design solutions as applicable.
Review & provide recommendation/input if/as applicable on new technologies/roadmap/presentations and Vendor product offerings specific to "System" Server, System Software technologies & Solutions & products.
Review & Identify Outsourcing Opportunities (e.g. ASP, IAAS, SAAS)
Evaluate & align strategic fit solutions across infrastructure platforms & solutions specific to "System" hardware & software technologies.
Understand, participate, review & influence long term capacity planning & technology investments.
Technical Consulting 

Provide Client consulting & planning guidance as applicable for moderate to large highly complex projects/programs.
Provide consultation & works closely with other functional infrastructure areas/departments on multiple initiatives to meet common organizational / business goals & objectives.
Participate in and provides consulting & planning guidance on short term & long term planning in order to meet ongoing business & operational needs.
Participate in and provides consulting to project teams on architectural, design development, integration opportunities, planning of highly complex systems & assures it is aligned to our established strategies, guiding principles, rationales & practices.
Develop & provide estimates for projects/programs & initiatives during consulting, planning & implementation review if/as applicable for projects & initiatives.
Planning & Organizing

Identify & evaluate projects/programs/initiatives & design processes that enhance & rationalize existing and upcoming solutions.
Map requirements into standard services solution, identity opportunities for integrating to existing or reuse technology & provide cost effective solutions for moderate to large highly complex project/programs/initiatives.
Review and propose alternate solutions to non-standard solutions if/as applicable to meet business & applications needs.
Review, identify & manage requirements for moderate to complex solutions and do a cost value, feasibility and risk analysis as appropriate.
Assist & provide guidance on complex/ large project/program planning phases & process. Direct and/or indirect management responsibility for large to enterprise size projects /programs/initiatives/services with high complexity across multiple functional area(s).
Risk Management 

Participate in CAB/ECAB and active assess risk of proposed changes.
Review, participate, develop (if/as applicable) & update architectural standards, guiding principles, rationales & strategies.
Evaluate, review & approve highly complex design solutions for business & Infrastructure project or programs or initiatives.
Administration 

Keep management informed of status of on activities through accurate, timely, and appropriate reporting.
Actively participates in committees representing the department and/or planning unit.
Keep abreast of leading edge technologies in engineering space.
Estimating cost saving targets.
Budget low cost hosting provider Relocation assistance is not provided for this position.
TravelTravel is not required for this position.
RelocationRelocation will not be provided for this position.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or High School Diploma or GED and 9 years of technology experience
8 years Technology project management experience complex, critical projects
8 years in identifying technical solutions for complex business problems, identifying the benefits and risks of the solutions and providing recommendations
8 years negotiating complex solutions
8 years designing complex solutions
5 years of mentoring another technologists
 2 years of experience with AWS and/or migration of application to AWS
 5 years of experience with API design and implementation
 5 years of experience with Java

Job Title: Part Time Bank Teller at Westwood
Job Description:
Job Description
Customer Service Representative
We invite you to explore the award-winning culture, people, rewards and opportunities that make Comerica Bank so special. Make your next career choice a confident one. The Customer Service Representative (CSR) is responsible for contributing to the overall success of a Retail Banking Center by committing to banker-readiness, conducting marketing activities leading to revenue growth in loans, deposits and noninterest income, contributing to the prescribed customer experience levels, maintaining disciplined operational objectives, while striving for excellence in execution in each of the mentioned areas. This position's work schedule involves occasional evenings and Saturdays and requires the lifting and movement of currency/coin packages weighing up to 25 pounds. Depending on location, this position could require extended periods of standing.
Position Competencies
Successful incumbents have composure, listening skills, a drive for results, time management, are customer focused, and have the ability to develop peer relationships.ResponsibilitiesMarketing Activities:* Execute the proactive marketing activities for the attraction, retention and expansion of customers.* Complete assigned Daily Planning activities. * Actively engaged in Banker Readiness by developing an in-depth knowledge of consumer and small business products and services. * Provide for Customer Engagement by introducing customers to Comerica's product and services and addressing customer questions, e.g., how-to use products and services and follows-up on a timely basis. * Support Consumer and Business Development, work targeted leads as assigned, update customer information, and identify customer needs.* Actively participate in Marketing Activity meetings and offer creative ideas. * Provide transactional customer service, including but not limited to the following: accept and process deposits, withdrawals and payments and handle other over the counter and mail transactions.* Provide remarkable customer service through all customer interactions, opening new accounts, problem resolution, telephone answering, safe deposit access, etc.* Impact the revenue growth of the Banking Center.* Other duties as assigned.
Operational Risk:* Ensure compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, and Comerica's policies and procedures. * Ensure compliance and completion of necessary compliance related training.* Adhere to all Banking Center Risk Assessment and Compliance standards.* Control losses by following policies and procedures.* Subject Matter expert for all Banking Center Operational Activities Tool (BOAT) assigned tasks to ensure proper completion of tasks. * Other duties as assigned.
Customer Experience:* Able to assess needs and add value to customers and prospects.* Introduce and refer customers to the Platform through routine interactions.* Perform routine customer requests.* Resolve basic customer complaints.* Maintain positive customer relationships.* Impact the customer experience following defined customer experience guidelines and other customer experience behaviors and feedback as needed.* Other duties as assigned.
Partnership:* Engage in activities that support Collaboration partnerships, partner engagement and relationships. * Impact the efforts that support Banking Center Collaboration.* Refer opportunities to the platform for further analysis in support of partner engagement. * Other duties as assigned.
RelocationNo relocation assistance is provided for this position.TravelTravel is not required of this position.
Qualifications
* High School Diploma OR GED* 1 year of experience in Customer Service experience* 6 months Retail or Financial sales experience OR 2 years of U.S. Military service OR 1 year of college* 1 year of personal computer, system data entry or Internet search experience

Job Title: Portfolio Manager- Technology and Life Sciences- McLean, VA
Job Description:
Job Description
Portfolio Manager I The Portfolio Manager I is responsible for managing portfolio of existing relationships for customers with revenues over $20MM to ensure ongoing profitability and complete conformity with credit terms. The role will ensure the sale of additional financial services and will maintain a basic understanding of commercial, economic and financial circumstances and how they impact the customers and prospective customers under their management. The role will also coordinate with key internal partners to support servicing of existing customer base.
Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, strong communication skills with the ability to prepare and deliver verbal and written presentations, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, presentation skills, business acumen and negotiating skills.
Responsibilities:Portfolio and Risk Management:* Retains and manages existing loan portfolio supporting up to two Relationship Managers. Takes ownership of all reviews and renewals for existing credit customers; portfolio includes less complex accounts. * Formulates an opinion of whether such relationships should continue to be an acceptable risk.* Decides loan terms and conditions, if within own credit limits or makes recommendations to appropriate authority.* Develops and maintains direct relationships with customers including an effort to call/contact; target a minimum of twice per year in person contact.* Provides oversight and guidance to credit support in underwriting for renewals and reviews. Provides qualitative input for RECAP creation.* Works in conjunction with manager to prepare for and present at loan committees and credit quality reviews as applicable. * Coordinates with Loan Closers to facilitate closing of renewals or amendments. * Adheres to Risk Management policies and guidelines, i.e. regulatory compliance, portfolio and credit quality, and portfolio management.* Assists with monitoring existing loans to ensure compliance with terms of loan agreement and recommends corrective action on variances.* Identifies & resolves operational and credit issues with loans held in portfolio.* Manages of all non-loan credit and product risk products for existing clients, including treasury (ACH, Business deposit capture, etc.) approvals and documentation.* Management of all ad hoc and regulatory reporting within existing portfolio [both internal and external requests].* Monitors, tracks, and assists in the collection of past due loan payments, exceptions, overdrafts, and maturing loans.* Provides day-to-day servicing of portfolio including credit risk monitoring. * Conducts interviews to develop information concerning the nature of the customer's business, financing or other needs.
Profitability:* Identifies and closes appropriate incremental financial solutions with the goal of retention and some expansion, in coordination with the RM (cross sales).* Retains existing portfolio and associated profitability.Additional Duties:* Promotes public bank image by being involved in meaningful community and business development activities, as appropriate.
RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position.
TravelTravel is not required for this position.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university
Completion of a Commercial Credit Training Program OR 3 years of experience in Lending or Credit including 1 year of experience underwriting commercial loans.
2 years of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Word, Excel Power Point and Outlook

Job Title: Fixed Income Trader in Bloomfield Hills, MI
Job Description:
Job Description
Fixed Income Trader 
The Fixed Income Trader serves as a key contributor to the efficiency and success of brokerage and managed account fixed income trading. Duties include proactively promoting, facilitating and executing trades in fixed income securities. The Fixed Income Trader is responsible for risk management, process management, and consultation with internal and external parties. The incumbent must have strong product knowledge and a deep understanding of all fixed income products, portfolio construction, investment management, regulatory reporting (MSRB/TRACE), and Best Execution obligations. Success will result in increased fixed income assets under management, improved business efficiencies and increased profitability for the Wealth Management division.
Position Competencies
Successful incumbents must have a fixed income trading background, properly licensed (Series 7 & 63), strong fixed income product knowledge, well versed in all aspects of fixed income, strong functional and technical skills, organized, action-oriented, display strong written communication skills, must be able to take ownership with problem solving, customer-focused and strive for self-development.
Position Responsibilities

Execute fixed income trading via Bloomberg's Trade Order Management System and ComTRAC
Transition fixed income positions into and out of client accounts
Present offerings and ideas to Comerica Securities, Wealth Asset Management and Comerica Asset Management while keeping their Wealth Management partners informed of current market conditions and pricing in the fixed income market
Successful interaction with Financial Consultants, Portfolio Managers, Wealth Advisors and Dealers to maintain active selling of fixed income
Balance risks against tax-benefits
Strong ability to multi-task
Relocation
Relocation assistance is not provided for this position.
Travel 
Less than 10% travel required of this position.
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Finance or related field from an accredited university
Series 7 and 63 (or 66)
5 years of Financial Industry experience
5 years of fixed income trading experience
5 years of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel) and Bloomberg experience

Job Title: Commercial Underwriter for Middle Market
Job Description:
Job Description
The Commercial Underwriter is responsible for underwriting and documentation of basic and less complex loan requests for assigned Lines of Business (LOBs) as well as owning deal analyses and execution of workflows according to established Service Level Agreements (SLAs), also responsible for assisting in the on-going monitoring of the credit exposure for assigned relationships, including renewals, reaffirmations and annual risk ratings.
Reporting Information:The Commercial Underwriter reports to the Manager Commercial Underwriting (MCU).
Position Competencies:Successful incumbents possess strong analytical, time management, verbal and written communication skills, are accountable and have strong data management capabilities.
Position Responsibilities:
1. Provide complete analysis of loan package for new deals, reviews and renewals

Prepares and/or updates appropriate RECAP documentation with guidance from MCU (Manager Credit Underwriting).
Prepares basic collateral charts, cash flows, risk ratings and other attachments.
Provides basic industry analysis.
Identifies policy exceptions and works with MCU/RM (Relationship Manager) to mitigate them.
Identifies and analyzes inconsistencies and inaccuracies in customer data, including spreads, aging's, projections and other financial documents.
Develops basic analytical narrative and commentary on the request.
Evaluates strengths and weaknesses of the credit and escalates risks and other issues to MCU and/or RM or PM (Portfolio Manager).
Assists RM/PM with contacting customers to obtain answers for loan analyses and recommend loan structures and covenants.
Prepares risk rating with guidance from MCU.

2. Administration

Monitors loan covenants and tracking on simple transactions in conjunction with CSC (Credit Support Center) support team for assigned relationships.
Shares responsibility with Credit Specialists for performing OFAC checks and identifying issues.
Investigates title searches, surveys and UCC (Uniform Commercial Code) searches as requested by MCU or RM/PM.

3. Process Sustainability

Adheres to department procedures for workload management.
Strives to meet or exceed SLA, or when not possible, communicate to MCU and RM/PM.
Ensures appropriate RECAP formats/attachments are used in accordance with approved process & procedures.
Other duties as assigned.

TravelTravel is not required of this position.
RelocationRelocation is not available for this position.
Work ScheduleThis positions work schedule may require overtime.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree
Two (2) Accounting courses (minimum 6 units)
1 year Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Business or Accounting
Strong academic track record:
3.0 cumulative GPA,
3.0 GPA average in the two (2) accounting courses
Demonstrated leadership and strong verbal and written communication skills

Work Schedule
8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday
Work Location(s)
Comerica West Headquarters

Job Title: Portfolio Manager
Job Description:
Job Description
Portfolio Manager II The Portfolio Manager II is responsible for managing portfolio of existing relationships for customers with revenue above $20MM to ensure ongoing profitability and complete conformity with credit terms. The role will ensure the sale of additional financial services and will maintain a basic understanding of commercial, economic and financial circumstances and how they impact the customers and prospective customers under their management. The role will also coordinate with key internal partners to support servicing of existing customer base.
Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, strong communication skills with the ability to prepare and deliver verbal and written presentations, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, presentation skills, business acumen and negotiating skills.
Responsibilities:Portfolio and Risk Management:* Retains and manages existing loan portfolio supporting three to four Relationship Managers. Takes ownership of all reviews and renewals for existing credit customers; portfolio includes complex accounts. * Formulates an opinion of whether such relationships should continue to be an acceptable risk.* Decides loan terms and conditions, if within own credit limits or makes recommendations to appropriate authority.* Develops and maintains direct relationships with customers including an effort to call/contact; target a minimum of twice per year in person contact.* Provides oversight and guidance to credit support in underwriting for renewals and reviews. Provides qualitative input for RECAP creation.* Works in conjunction with manager to prepare for and present at loan committees and credit quality reviews as applicable. * Coordinates with Loan Closers to facilitate closing of renewals or amendments. * Adheres to Risk Management policies and guidelines, i.e. regulatory compliance, portfolio and credit quality, and portfolio management.* Assists with monitoring existing loans to ensure compliance with terms of loan agreement and recommends corrective action on variances.* Identifies & resolves operational and credit issues with loans held in portfolio.* Manages all non-loan credit and product risk products for existing clients, including treasury (ACH, Business deposit capture, etc.) approvals and documentation.* Manages ad hoc and regulatory reporting within existing portfolio [both internal and external requests].* Monitors, tracks, and assists in the collection of past due loan payments, exceptions, overdrafts, and maturing loans.* Provides day-to-day servicing of portfolio including credit risk monitoring. * Conducts interviews to develop information concerning the nature of the customer's business, financing or other needs.Profitability:* Identifies and closes appropriate incremental financial solutions with the goal of retention and expansion (cross sales).* Retains existing portfolio and associated profitability.Additional Duties:* Promotes public bank image by being involved in meaningful community and business development activities, as appropriate.
RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position.
TravelTravel is not required for this position.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university
Completion of a Commercial Credit Training Program AND 2 years of commercial underwriting, credit and/or lending experience OR 5 years of experience in Lending or Credit
2 years of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Word, Excel Power Point and Outlook

Job Title: Regional Operations Manager, First Level Officer, Austin or San Antonio
Job Description:
Job Description
Regional Operations Manager- Retail Bank The Regional Operations Manager maintains an in depth knowledge of banking center related automation systems and procedures as well as analyzes and implements banking center related system/procedure changes, provides feedback as to their impact on the banking center distribution system. In addition, the Regional Operations Manager participates in projects such as software installations, banking center openings/closings, and banking center facility renovations and improves workflow techniques. All activities are to be focused on the efficient operation of the banking center system with the stated purpose to improve sales and customer service.
Position Responsibilities:
1. Provide consultative and consistent guidance on corrective action measures to be taken for differences, losses, attendance, punctuality, cash count discrepancies, etc. for non-exempt. Assist with documentation and training of operational corrective actions. 2. Oversee self-audits at all banking centers as well as conduct the Banking center Operational Reviews. 3. Provide oversight and follow-up to ensure banking centers are in compliance with various regulations (i.e. Reg. D, Reg. CC, Reg. DD, CTR/MCTR, etc.). Review periodic operational reports and follow up where appropriate. 4. Ensure banking centers have completed required CBT courses and other regulatory videos or training. 5. Attend and assist banking center after robberies. 6. Respond to banking center shipment variance requests. 7. Provide non-sales training i.e. AML, new procedures, transaction authority, etc. 8. Identify and implement banking center specific workflow efficiencies and provide feedback to Market Operations on procedures that affect all banking centers. 9. Attend monthly meeting and then communicate to banking centers about operational changes. 10. Assist and elevate need for equipment repair/replacement. Assist with Facility issues and outstanding work orders. 11. Represent banking centers and Regional Managers on operational project teams. 12. Assist with the opening, closing, relocation, and remodeling of banking centers.
Travel Travel is extensive within the Texas area for this position.
RelocationRelocation is not available for this position.
Qualifications

High school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED)
5 years in retail bank branch management or retail bank branch operations support position
5 years of coaching, counseling, and training employees
2 years of experience with MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint

Work Schedule
8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday-Friday

Highway 281 Banking Center

Job Title: Trust Advisor III in Detroit
Job Description:
Job Description
Trust Advisor IIIThe Trust Advisor III is responsible for serving as a relationship manager to more routine client relationships by providing wealth management advice and counsel on standard wealth planning issues.  This position's direct involvement in business development is expected to contribute to the achievement of the annual net new business goal for the division. Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents possess ethics and values, listening and presentation skills, problem solving, priority setting and negotiating skills are politically savvy and have a drive for results.
 
Position Responsibilities:

Manages more routine accounts in accordance with the terms of the various governing documents, applicable law, and consistent with the needs of the principals, income beneficiaries, and remaindermen.
Reviews, analyzes and interprets documents for direction; evaluates accounts for completeness and accuracy, monitors and reviews account transactions, responds to incoming correspondence and any other client requests to ensure compliance with the governing document, applicable law and policies and procedures.
Works with supervisor in developing solutions to most issues brought forth by principals, income beneficiaries and remaindermen such as requests for special distributions, fee issues or disputes.
Oversees the opening and closing of accounts, ensures the receipt of proper and legally required documentation, ensures the full and complete transfer of assets, their cost basis, and the proper characterization of cash as income or principal, ensures all tax codes and account administration codes are accurate and oversees tax reporting activities, coordinating with outside CPAs and advisors.
Provides comprehensive wealth planning advice to clients. May participate in projects which affect the broader business and improves efficiency of delivery of services to clients.
Develops new business through referrals from external and internal centers of influence and/or through expansion of business within current book of clients.

 TravelTravel is not required of this position
 
RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position. 
Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university
6 years of experience serving as an account administrator in a specific area of expertise to include trust administration, investments or insurance in a client service capacity
6 years of business development experience in trust administration, investments or insurance

Job Title: Senior Wealth Advisor Bloomfield Hills
Job Description:
Job Description
Vice President, Senior Wealth AdvisorThe Vice President, Senior Wealth Advisor is responsible for contributing to the overall success of the Wealth & Institutional Management business unit by building and maintaining a high performing book of business and being accountable for the success of the client relationship. Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents are action oriented, have strong banking acumen and peer relationships, negotiate, have innovative management, are customer focused, and drive for results.
 
Position Responsibilities:1.      Sales Management

Achieve annual new business fee goals by formulating and coordinating a custom marketing plan for assigned market; organizing and conducting investment management, estate planning and trust seminars for communities and individuals in order to identify prospects for services.
Design and implement the sales process by carefully matching specialists to clients; coaching selected specialists throughout the process; and keeping the sales process, specialists and advisors on target and on schedule.
Attract new customers and retain existing customers by developing marketing materials, plan presentations and strategies. Follow-up on all sales leads and calls.
Build a strong network by participating in community affairs, activities and organizations to maintain visibility and enhance the business development function.
Be viewed as an advisor by serving as a resource speaker for related activities.
2.      Client Management

Determine client needs by meeting with them to review needs and obtain background data on corporate or personal finances, family relationships, investment objectives and financial planning; listen, profile, gather information to assess client needs, biases and objectives.
Assess opportunities and determine alternatives and solutions to meet client needs.
Obtain client commitment and collect assets.
Effectively transition the client relationship to the relationship manager by staying involved with the client until the relationship is fully cemented.
Demonstrate expertise by managing or working with the client's outside advisors; and setting the stage for follow-up sales opportunities.
3.      Account Management 

Oversee the preparation of new account documentation by ensuring documentation flow and timelines are efficient and thorough.
Effectively manage issue by navigating internal territory concerns by finding the best solution for the client; orchestrating the appropriate providers; and addressing service issues where appropriated. 
 
TravelTravel is not required of this position.

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university
10 years sales experience in personal trust, investment or financial products
5 years developing and executing sales marketing plans

Job Title: Business Unit Risk Analyst II   Senior Business Continuity Consultant   Dallas
Job Description:
Job Description

Summary
The Senior Business Continuity Consultant role will strengthen Comerica's preparedness for Disruptive Events by consulting with business units, affiliates, and (when needed) High Risk 3rd Party Suppliers across the enterprise regarding Business Continuity preparedness, Work Area Recovery solutions, Disaster Recovery strategies, and infrastructure.
Current DRII industry certification preferred. 
Manage small-large corporate resiliency initiatives and develop physical provisioning which supports maintenance of critical operations during Disruptive Events, and the capability of restoring normal operations upon conclusion of a disruption.
Provide functional support for various Corporate Continuity & Recovery Management (CCRM) Program initiatives.
Support compliance with Business Continuity Program, Federal and State Regulations, and Internal Audit requirements.
Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, have strong inter-personal and communication skills, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, and ability to multi-task and have strong organizational skills.
Job Function:

Coordinate Business Continuity and Incident Support Plan, testing, and maintenance efforts to ensure Comerica's ability to recover critical operations following a disruption to Critical Business Unit operations, facilities, or technology systems.
Consult with Business Units and affiliates from all locations regarding preparedness for Disruptive Events.
Work with Critical (Tier 1 & 2) Business Units to develop sound Work Area Recovery strategies and solutions.
Analyze Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery/Incident Support/Executive Plans and Infrastructure preparedness.
Develop recommendations for improvement and report results to line and senior management.
Develop and execute Business Continuity/Incident Support/Work Area Recovery Site/Event Management/Disaster Recovery tests for critical mainframe, mid-range, network, and PC platforms across the enterprise.
Develop recommendations to improve Business Continuity and Event Management preparedness, report results to management.
Conduct Business Continuity Program and Disaster Recovery reviews for critical suppliers. Develop and submit recommendations to the Business Units responsible for managing the supplier relationship, when needed.
 
Core Responsibilities 

Develop/Maintain small-large corporate resiliency initiatives to support Comerica's Business Continuity Program objectives, enhance preparedness for Disruptive Events and restore normal operations after conclusion of a disruption.
Coordinate the installation of physical provisions required to optimize the maintenance of critical core business processes and restoration of normal operations.
Manage the development, implementation, and testing of required physical systems and infrastructure, to optimize the maintenance of critical business functions and restoration of normal operations. Where required, research contractual alternatives in support of these initiatives.
Serve on the regional Incident Support Team representing Corporate Continuity & Recovery Management, as required.
Provide High level crisis response support on a regional or national level, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as required.
Develop and maintain knowledge of business continuity industry policies, standards, and practices; knowledge of Comerica's Business Continuity Program; and awareness of risk indices and trends which could affect Comerica's' ability to execute its Business Continuity Plans.
Conduct viability tests for Business Unit Work Area Recovery Solutions and organizational Event Management Teams.
Manage Telecommunications Disaster Recovery Testing and Routing on Demand Provisioning.
Analyze test results and develop recommendations to improve client area preparedness, as required.
Participate in appropriate professional organizations, e.g. Association of Continuity Professionals (ACP).
Additional Responsibilities

Develop and maintain a high level of proficiency with the corporate-wide Business Continuity Planning platform (Archer).
Train and support Business Units and affiliates across the enterprise in effectively using Archer to develop, maintain, document, and utilize their Business Continuity Plans.
Administration 

Keep manager informed on status of activities through accurate, timely, and appropriate reporting.
Actively participates in committees representing the department and/or planning unit, as requested or required.
RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position.
Travel40% Regional Travel is required for this position.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or High School Diploma or GED and 7 years of experience in business or technology
6 years of experience in a Business Continuity / Resiliency Program discipline, that includes development, testing, and maintenance of Business Continuity or System Recovery Plans.
3 years of experience working with business continuity standards and FFIEC regulatory requirements.
 
3 years of experience in building and maintaining Work Area Recovery Solutions for Recoverable Planning Units deemed as critical
2 years of experience working within or alongside Information Services Technology environment from a Data processing and telecommunications perspective.
 
Work Schedule
8am to 5pm
Work Location(s)
NorthPark Offices

Job Title: Wire Operations Manager
Job Description:
Job Description

Wire Transfer Operations Manager 
The Wire Transfer Operations Manager position has direct reports and is responsible for the day to day operations in the wire room from 8:00 am EST to 8:00 pm EST. This position is responsible for managing directly and through subordinates all operational activities needed to support the processing of domestic/international wire transactions, customer service, and OFAC monitoring.
Reporting Information and Location 
The Wire Transfer Operations Manager position is primarily located Auburn Hills, MI, however the incumbent will spend 20% of their time at the Livonia Operations Center. The position reports to the Vice President.
Position Core Values
Successful incumbents have strong Customer-centricity, are Collaborative, have high Integrity, strive for Excellence, are Agile, promote Diversity and are involved in our community.
Position Responsibilities

Job Description:
Job Description
Treasury Management Sales Associate II The Treasury Management Sales Associate II (TMSA II) role will be involved with the sales and support of Treasury Management products to external and internal clients. The TMSA II will assist clients with routine sales inquiries; assist in the preparation of proposals. Success in this role requires the ability to provide a high level of customer service and satisfaction. Critical attributes in this position includes having high attention to detail and timeliness and being able to provide accurate documentations.
Position Competencies:Successful incumbents possess written and verbal communications skills, sales and relationship management skills, analytical and problem solving skills, and organizational and time management skills. Must also possess adaptability and flexibility in process, technology and industry.
Position Responsibilities:

Sales

Meet or exceed assigned individual sales/revenue goals.
Participate in client calls with TM Sales Officer including in person calls.
Identify sales opportunities through needs based assessment, campaigns, prospecting, reviewing account analysis statements and marketing lists to meet or exceed sales goals. Use information to prepare and execute sales plan with TMSO.
Responsible to cross sell / up sell TM Solutions to existing customers.
Work closely with TM Sales Officer and Relationship Manager to understand the client's business environment, strategies and industry to determine their requirements, identify potential new business opportunities and provide innovative solutions.
Prepare annual client relationship account structure analysis; review account analysis statements for additional sales opportunities; create client relationship reviews including product recommendations based on clients business and industry changes.
Coordinate and / or conduct product demonstrations for clients. Utilize industry research tools, benchmarking, peer results and new / enhanced treasury management products to identify portfolio sales opportunities.
Sales Support 

Prepare, organize and respond to Request for Proposals.
Prepare proposals and presentations and cost benefit analysis, as well as other sales tools.
Generate proformas; interpret competitors account analysis statement and determine comparative Comerica product and pricing recommendations.
Manage special pricing approval process; work with TM Sales Officer and Relationship Manager to prepare documents and rationale for the special pricing committee.
Manage and oversee the implementation process for new business; prepare all documentation and legal agreements ensuring that audit requirements are met to mitigate risk and legal liability; respond to issues related to the implementation, engage business partners and escalate, as appropriate.
Identify, diagnose and resolve client issues; engage business partners and communicate with customer, TM Sales Officer and/or Relationship Manager.
Identify, evaluate and mitigate risks associated with TM products; collaborate with TMO, RM and TM Risk to ensure process within credit policy.
Recognize, mitigate and escalate risk issues such as cyber-risk, product risk, and operational risk.
Projects

Proactively identify evaluate, recommend and implement changes to operational processes / procedures resulting in departmental efficiencies.
Participate on projects impacting TM Sales representing "voice of the customer".
Participate in coordination and planning of client and industry events such as AFP, TEXPO, Strategic Advisory Council and theCustomer Forum.
 Other projects as assigned.

3 years of financial service experience including sales and customer service
2 years of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
2 years of experience with Treasury Management products and services

Job Title: Sr Staff Engineer  Voice Engineering  Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description

Senior Staff Engineer
The Senior Staff Engineer role will provide engineering support for complex system management activities related to system software, hardware, performance, problem determination or resource management requiring communication and coordination with vendors, technicians, clients, and management. It will also provide technical input to management decision making in the area of software, hardware, and performance. Its' responsibilities include: defining networking requirements; performing detailed analysis of various projects and requests; developing designs for projects that have medium to high complexity; formulating procedures; monitoring key performance indicators; and implementing advanced business solutions. It may also integrate systems or operate in a DevOps model depending on the maturity of the organization and/or product.
Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, have strong inter-personal and communication skills, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, and ability to multi-task and have strong organizational skills.
Responsibilities:Design & Methodology 
* Investigate & propose a strategic fit solution technology.
* Work closely with Business Units, Application teams, infrastructure areas & Vendors to identity, review & evaluate the solution requirements. 
* Investigate & propose strategic fits for Virtualization, Consolidation & Rationalization solution opportunities within the infrastructure or business. Propose changes to the technical design solutions as applicable. 
* Review & provide recommendation/input if/as applicable on new technologies/roadmap/presentations and Vendor product offerings specific to "System" Server, System Software technologies & Solutions & products.
* Evaluate & align strategic fit solutions across platforms & solutions specific to "System" hardware & software technologies.
* Understand, participate, review & influence long term capacity planning & technology investments.
Technical Consulting 
* Provide Client consulting & planning guidance as applicable for moderate to complex projects/programs.
* Provide consultation & works closely with other functional infrastructure areas/departments on multiple initiatives to meet common organizational / business goals & objectives.
* Participate in and provides consulting & planning guidance on short term & long term planning in order to meet ongoing business & operational needs. 
* Participate in and provides consulting to project teams on architectural, design development, integration opportunities, planning of complex systems & assures it is aligned to our established strategies, guiding principles, rationales & practices. 
* Develop & provide estimates for projects/programs & initiatives during consulting, planning & implementation review if/as applicable for projects & initiatives.
Planning & Organizing
* Identify & evaluate projects/programs/initiatives & design processes that enhance & rationalize existing and upcoming solutions.
* Map requirements into standard services solution, identity opportunities for integrating to existing or reuse technology & provide cost effective solutions for moderate to large highly complex project/programs/initiatives.
* Review and propose alternate solutions to non-standard solutions if/as applicable to meet business & applications needs.
* Review, identify & manage requirements for moderate to complex solutions and do a cost value, feasibility and risk analysis as appropriate.
* Assist & provide guidance on complex/ large project/program planning phases & process. Direct and/or indirect management responsibility for large to enterprise size projects /programs/initiatives/services with high complexity across multiple functional area(s).
Risk Management 
* Participate in CAB/ECAB and active assess risk of proposed changes.
* Review, participate, develop (if/as applicable) & update architectural standards, guiding principles, rationales & strategies.
* Evaluate, review & approve highly complex design solutions for business & Infrastructure project or programs or initiatives.
Administration 
* Keep management informed of status of on activities through accurate, timely, and appropriate reporting. 
* Actively participates in committees representing the department and/or planning unit.
* Keep abreast of leading edge technologies in engineering space.
* Estimating cost saving targets.
* Budget low cost hosting provider.
RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position.
TravelTravel is not required for this position.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or High School Diploma or GED and 8 years of technology experience
7 years leading technology projects with large to complex sized projects
7 years in identifying technical solutions for complex business problems, identifying the benefits and risks of the solutions and providing recommendations
6 years design experience with 3 years advanced design experience
3 years full life cycle development in an enterprise development environment
3 years configuration management concepts and tools 
3 years design and modeling tools 
3 years working in a DevOps model
6 years of experience in voice engineering.
5 years of experience administering, deploying troubleshooting and supporting UCCE 7.5 and 11.6 platforms. 
5 years of ICM scripting experience
2 years call studio scripting experience 

Work Schedule
8am to 5pm
Work Location(s)
Auburn Hills Technical Center

Job Title: Staff Engineer  DevOps Software Engineer  Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description

Staff Engineer
The Staff Engineer role will provide engineering support for system management activities related to system software, hardware, performance, problem determination or resource management requiring communication and coordination with vendors, technicians, clients, and management. It will also provide technical input to management decision making in the area of software, hardware, and performance. This role responsibilities include: defining networking requirements; performing detailed analysis of various projects and requests; developing designs for projects that have medium to high complexity; formulating procedures; monitoring key performance indicators; and implementing advanced business solutions. It may also integrate systems or build systems via the DevOps model depending on the maturity of the organization and/or product. 
Position Competencies Successful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, have strong inter-personal and communication skills, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, and ability to multi-task and have strong organizational skills.
Responsibilities: Design & Methodology 
* Investigate & propose a strategic fit solution technology.
* Work closely with Business Units, Application teams, infrastructure areas & Vendors to identity, review & evaluate the solution requirements. 
* Investigate & propose strategic fits for Virtualization, Consolidation & Rationalization solution opportunities within the infrastructure or business. Propose changes to the technical design solutions as applicable. 
* Review & provide recommendation/input if/as applicable on new technologies/roadmap/presentations and Vendor product offerings specific to "System" Server, System Software technologies & Solutions & products.
* Evaluate & align strategic fit solutions across platforms & solutions specific to "System" hardware & software technologies.
* Understand, participate, review & influence long term capacity planning & technology investments.
Technical Consulting 
* Provide Client consulting & planning guidance as applicable for moderate projects/programs.
* Provide consultation & works closely with other functional infrastructure areas/departments on multiple initiatives to meet common organizational / business goals & objectives.
* Participate in and provides consulting & planning guidance on short term & long term planning in order to meet ongoing business & operational needs. 
* Participate in and provides consulting to project teams on design development, integration opportunities, planning of systems & assures it is aligned to our established strategies, guiding principles, rationales & practices. 
* Develop & provide estimates for projects/programs & initiatives during consulting, planning & implementation review if/as applicable for projects & initiatives
Planning & Organizing
* Identify & evaluate projects/programs/initiatives & design processes that enhance & rationalize existing and upcoming solutions.
* Map requirements into standard services solution, identity opportunities for integrating to existing or reuse technology & provide cost effective solutions for moderate to large highly complex project/programs/initiatives.
* Review and propose alternate solutions to non-standard solutions if/as applicable to meet business & applications needs.
* Review, identify & manage requirements for moderate solutions and do a cost value, feasibility and risk analysis as appropriate.
* Assist & provide guidance on project/program planning phases & process. Direct and/or indirect management responsibility for large to enterprise size projects /programs/initiatives/services with high complexity across multiple functional area(s).
Risk Management 

· Participate in CAB/ECAB and active assess risk of proposed changes.
· Review, participate, develop (if/as applicable) & update guiding principles, rationales & strategies.
· Evaluate, review & approve design solutions for business & Infrastructure project or programs or initiatives.

Administration 

· Keep management informed of status of on activities through accurate, timely, and appropriate reporting. 
· Actively participates in committees representing the department and/or planning unit.
· Keep abreast of leading edge technologies in engineering space.
· Estimating cost saving targets.

Relocation Relocation assistance is not provided for this position.
Travel Travel is not required for this position.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or High School Diploma or GED and 7 years of technology experience
5 years leading technology projects with medium to large size projects
5 years identifying technical solutions for business problems - identifying the benefits and risks of the solutions and providing recommendations
5 years design experience with 2 years advanced design experience
2 years full life cycle development in an enterprise development environment
2 years configuration management concepts and tools
2 years design and modeling tools
2 years working in a DevOps model

Job Title: Domain CIO, Senior Vice President - Electronic Payments
Job Description:
Job Description

Domain CIO, Senior Vice President -- Electronic Payments 
This role is accountable for all technology applications and related technology services that are part of the Electronic Payments & Strategy Development Domain (Real Time Payments, Enterprise Payments Architecture, Wire, ACH, SWIFT, and Blockchain). The Domain CIO will have end-to-end accountability for Domain Technical strategy and architecture; Business Partner relationship management for IT products and services; Agile and DevOps product delivery and testing; Product APIs; Major Program management and Level 3 application support. The Domain CIO will report to the Chief Information Officer of Comerica Bank and will be a member of the Technology Leadership Team.
Responsibilities
Strategy:

Partner with the Line of Business to create and execute a technology strategy that will enhance overall business capabilities
Stay abreast of technology industry trends and best practices
Continuously transform the organization to increase efficiencies and reduce overall expense
Delivery Planning and Execution: 

Create, prioritize, plan and execute portfolio/product roadmaps through collaboration with Product Management and DevOps, including the on-going resequencing of projects in the portfolio roadmap as priorities shift.
Reduce time to market by utilizing Agile methodologies
Manage resource allocations, budget and time to market
Risk and Compliance:

Ensures Domain's compliance and control activities support technology and enterprise business objectives and are aligned with executive risk tolerances and expectations.
Ensures processes and controls within Domain enhance performance, security, reliability and availability of systems
Technology/Operational Control:

Lead integration and synergy between architecture/technology planning and development initiatives, providing direction and decisions in application development.
Cultivate good system management disciplines including clearly defined and documented roles and responsibilities, documented phase processes and checkpoint and detailed planning for system deployment
Leadership:

Manage the financials of the Domain with attention to the details of budgets while exhibiting a strict cost discipline and financial performance
Manage and develop team cultivating a spirit of one team with shared goals and objectives.
Select, motivate and retain high performing talent
Qualifications


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Math
10 years of Technology experience
10 years of leading transformation technology initiatives
10 years of managing complex products
8 years of leading full lifecycle programs or project management experience
8 years of leading large diverse teams that are responsible for end to product delivery
8 years of managing complex technology budgets
8 years of managing Payment Systems, Wire, SWIFT, ACH, and EPA
1 year of knowledge of RTP and Blockchain

The Retail Personal Banker (RPB) is responsible for contributing to the overall success of a Retail Banking Center by committing to banker-readiness, conducting marketing activities leading to revenue growth in loans, deposits and noninterest income, contributing to the prescribed customer experience levels, maintaining disciplined operational objectives, while striving for excellence in execution in each of the mentioned areas. This position's work schedule involves occasional evenings and Saturdays and requires the lifting and movement of currency/coin packages weighing up to 25 pounds.

Successful incumbents have composure, listening skills, a drive for results, time management, are customer focused, and have the ability to develop peer relationships.Responsibilities
Marketing Activities:* Executes the proactive marketing activities for the attraction, retention and expansion of customers.* Completes assigned Daily Planning activities.* Provides effective New Customer Onboarding and Customer Engagement by, in part, routinely strengthening new customer relationships, introducing new and existing customers to Comerica's product and services, addressing customer questions, e.g., how-to use products and services and follows-up on a timely basis. * Participates in the acquisition of consumer and business clients through the effective use of targeted leads, self- sourcing new business, managing referral source relationships. * Supports Portfolio Management efforts to retain, expand and increase the number of portfolio customers in the Banking Center.* Impact the revenue growth of the Banking Center.* Other duties as assigned.

Partnership:* Impact the efforts that support Banking Center Collaboration.* Develop a relationship with the partner to support business development.* Identify opportunities to add value to customers by introducing them to partners.* Other duties as assigned.

Job Title: Direct Marketing Campaign Specialist - Auburn Hills, MI OR Dallas, TX
Job Description:
Job Description
Direct Marketing Campaign Specialist:
The Direct Marketing Campaign Specialist role is to support the overall marketing mission and revenue-generating business lines by utilizing direct marketing (direct mail, email and telemarketing) best practices and techniques while leveraging future state of the art marketing automation tools. This role will lead strategy, execution, measurement and optimization of direct marketing campaigns on behalf of all business lines, and manage the complexities of the direct marketing process, working with both internal marketing colleagues and key vendor partners to ensure the timely and effective delivery of direct marketing activities, as well as determine approach to market, quantity, test and learn strategies, mailing frequency and other operational aspects of campaigns to meet deadlines.
Position Competencies:
Successful incumbents possess critical, strategically and analytically thinking, knowledge of and understand direct marketing (direct mail, email and telemarketing) principles & concepts, campaign management, analytics and knowledge of customer databases and marketing automation platforms and excellent verbal and written skills.
Responsibilities:
* Manage, design and fulfill a variety of marketing efforts ranging from customer acquisition to customer retention campaigns using direct mail, email and telemarketing channels.* Effectively interface with cross-functional teams to understand overall business strategy and proactively initiate, plan and recommend how direct marketing can most effectively and efficiently achieve P&L strategies and objectives.* Lead creative process and execution. Leverage potential creative, production and market timing synergies across channels, markets and consumer segments.* Analyze campaign performance and findings to aid in targeting, segmentation and testing strategies.* Proactively develop and recommend new marketing and segmentation ideas to enhance direct marketing sales results. * Leverage existing customer/prospect models and optimization techniques to inform Next Best Offer decisions.* Manage the integration & coordination of all internal & external resources to ensure all marketing campaigns and communications are executed in a timely, accurate & legally compliant manner.* Track and maintain direct marketing workflow including briefs, legal and compliance reviews, creative proofing and project/deadline management.* Manage and facilitate the logistics for all direct marketing campaigns, including the coordination of transferring lists between various sources, applications, and vendors.* Collaborate with Analytics/Reporting team to help define and provide needed campaign reporting. Manage strategic changes to future direct marketing campaigns based on findings and analysis to continue to drive increased response rates and return on investment.* Ensure direct marketing campaigns launch on-time, are within budget and yield positive ROI results. Contribute to maintenance of direct marketing calendar.
Travel:
Some Travel is required for this position.
Relocation:
Relocation assistance is not available.
Qualifications
* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university * 5 years of experience in direct marketing concepts, customer databases, campaign management and analytics* 2 years of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)

8:00 AM - 5:00 PM Monday - Friday

Job Title: Principal Architect  Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description
Principal Architect
The Principal Architect is responsible for necessary leadership, facilitation, analysis and design tasks related to the development of an enterprise technical architecture that applies across multiple Comerica business domains. Provides technology direction and guidance for strategic projects/initiatives aligned with enterprise architecture principles and considerations. Provides deep expertise of overall systems architecture across layers -- app, OS, data, network, storage, security etc. and their inter-dependencies across business domains and implications. Responsible for evaluating, selecting and recommending relevant technology, tools and practices aligned with business strategy and priorities and applicable to multiple domains.
Position Competencies
The successful incumbent has exceptional interpersonal skills and strong leadership skills. Incumbent has excellent written and verbal communication skills, analytical, technical, planning and organizational skills. 
Responsibilities
Innovation

Perform research activities to identify emerging technologies and trends that may affect the enterprise.
Maintain awareness of vendor/product industry developments, regulations and trends and identify potential impacts to the enterprise.
Assist in vendor/product selection activities including the development of vendor/product evaluation models used in Requests for Proposal (RFP's).
Design and oversee efforts in building effective bank specific Proof of Concept demonstrations and socialize the results throughout the enterprise and all levels of management.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key vendor partners to keep on track for core technologies.
Develops and maintains strong relationships with business domain leadership to keep track of changing business needs and priorities.
Provide technical/business consulting to internal IS organizations and client-sponsored activities outside of IS.

Strategy

· Lead or support enterprise capability definition aligned with business strategy.
· Capable of leading cost/benefit analysis of technologies/tools and technology roadmaps.
· Provide technical/business consulting to internal IS organizations and client-sponsored activities outside of IS.
· Acquire and maintain deep understanding of Comerica's business domain specific business processes, supporting applications, integrations & dependencies, security model, technology constraints & limitations.
· Analyze the business drivers that determine key architecture requirements. 
· Develop the process for creating a technical strategy that supports the business strategy and facilitate its development, and maintenance. 
· Highly engaged and drive strategic domain specific initiatives and programs from a technology perspective.
· Develops and maintains strong relationships with business domain leadership to keep track of changing business needs and priorities.
· Contribute to the Enterprise Architecture community by developing reference architectures, training/certification material etc.
· Guide & mentor domain solution architects.

Enterprise Architecture Governance

Perform technical architecture planning activities.
Facilitate and develop architectural standards for key technologies.
Mentor Agile/DevOps practices and proceduresamong domain teams.
Facilitate the development and evolution of the architecture and global governance processes.
Define and facilitate the process for approving architecture principles and standards.
Develop different methods to communicate effectively the Enterprise Architecture.
Mentor IS team members in the principles of Enterprise Architecture.


· Develop, collect and analyze Enterprise Architecture metrics to identify continual improvement opportunities.

 
Relocation
No relocation assistance is provided for this position.
 
Travel
Travel is not required for this position 
 
Qualifications

· Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in the field of Math, Science or Technology and minimum of 9 years' experience OR 12 years equivalent work experience
· 8 years leading large complex technology projects
· 7 years identifying technical solutions for complex business problems
· 7 years of negotiating complex solutions
· 7 years of designing complex solutions
· 5 years of mentoring other technologists

8am to 5pm

Auburn Hills Technical Center

Job Description
HR Information Technology, Talent Acquisition Consultant 
The successful Information Technology Talent Acquisition Consultant effectively fills positions on a timely basis by recruiting, screening, interviewing, and converting candidates.  Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents are action oriented, have strong banking acumen, can manage conflict, are customer focused, can make quality decisions, have interpersonal savvy, can learn on the fly, have organizational agility, are skilled at peer relationships, can listen effectively and are problem solvers.Scope of KnowledgePossess and applies the fundamental concepts, practices and procedures to aid in the completion of moderate to highly complex assignments in Human Resources Talent Acquisition.Major Responsibilities:- Under limited supervision, takes an individual contributor role in the execution of administers policies and programs to a client base in the following areas: Human Resources Talent Acquisition; heavy emphasis on Sourcing Management.Sourcing Management -- Actively source and recruit qualified candidates utilizing various search tools, processes and strategy. - Independently conduct individual searches for responsible open positions utilizing active, colleague, and passive candidate search strategies.- Determine necessary sourcing strategy and provide consultation to the hiring manager regarding direction.- Assist Talent Acquisition leadership with the execution of large complex search projects for a given line of business.- Assessment Management -- Independently screen qualified candidates to assess for basic qualifications as well as to assess experience and competency fit utilizing appropriate selection tools. - Make independent decisions on the recommendations to hiring managers of the best qualified candidates for the position.- Drive overall selection process to ensure compliance with established selection process.- Candidate Management -- Provides full life-cycle compelling recruiting services with limited supervision to candidates, ultimately attracting them to Comerica. - Disposition candidates in an OFCCP compliant and consistent manner. - Understand candidates' needs. Make decisions and adjust needs to Comerica's positions. Ensure candidates have a realistic job description and preview. - Correspond with candidates that are moving through the selection process, keep them interested and maintain a remarkable experience throughout. - Convert candidates to an offer effectively. Ensure completion of necessary compliance related training.

 -2 years of Information Technology recruiting - 2 years of experience using any major applicant tracking system - 2 year project participation - 2 year fundamental knowledge and application of Web 2.0 search techniques - Intermediate proficiency of MS Office

Job Title: Senior Marketing Data Analytics Manager
Job Description:
Job Description
 
SENIOR MARKETING DATA ANALYTICS MANAGER (Dallas TX or Auburn Hills, MI)
Comerica invites you to explore the award-winning culture, people, rewards and opportunities that make our bank so special. Make your next career choice a confident one. The Senior Marketing Data Analytics Manager will report directly to the Executive Vice-President & Chief Marketing Officer and be responsible for providing strategic support to all revenue-generating lines of business at Comerica Bank.
Position Competencies:
Successful incumbents have strong functional and technical data skills, can learn on the fly, are effective problem solvers, are highly collaborative, inform as needed, are action-oriented, display strong written communication skills, are customer focused and strive for self-development.
Position Responsibilities:
The Senior Marketing Data Analytics Manager will oversee the Data Strategy & Operations (DSO) Function within the Corporate Marketing department and oversee the company's efforts to strategically leverage customer data as a source of insight and intelligence that fuels our revenue-generating strategies and tactics. This position will partner closely with both marketing strategists, digital marketing experts and a team of data marketing analysts & modelers to lead a robust data marketing program that fuels Comerica's acquisition, cross-sell and retention efforts across all business lines. 
Salesforce CRM
In addition, the Senior Marketing Data Analytics Manager will represent Corporate Marketing in the cross-functional implementation of the Salesforce CRM platform. This involvement will include:

· Identification of marketing capability needs vis-à-vis the Salesforce and Salesforce Marketing Cloud platforms 
· Management of Salesforce reporting capabilities related to lead generation, lead distribution, campaign management and attribution
· Analysis of Salesforce campaign efforts to determine opportunities, shortcomings and ideas for optimization

Campaign Management responsibilities

· Solicit data provisioning requirements from key stakeholders (marketing team leaders, business unit leaders) and convert these requirements into data strategies and deliverables.
· Lead the process for audience segmentation and targeting, including test and learn strategies and next best offer campaigns.
· Continually assess data integration needs and work with Technology partners to maintain an integration roadmap that helps deliver on marketing needs
· Evaluate third-party data sources and recommend integrations where applicable
· Collaborate with Digital Marketing team to integrate campaign audience selection with media and channel logistics.
· Develop and maintain repeatable processes and workflows for managing people, calendars, budgets, and schedules.
· Translate the insights gained through campaign performance reporting into campaign analytic model development and campaign strategy adjustment.

Analytics Management

· Lead the process for campaign targeting and predictive model development.
· Work with the Technology Data Function to build, test, validate and deploy predictive models for use in campaigns, and ensure models are repeatable assets that score the marketable population on a regular basis.
· Develop next best offer analytics strategies and develops analytic strategies to monitor changes in customer behavior.
· Validate the marketing analytics model catalog and ensures the portfolio of models meets banking regulatory criteria.

Marketing Data Management

· Work closely with Comerica Information Systems and professional services partners to maintain a healthy marketing data environment as implemented in Comerica's Marketing Analytics Platform (MAP).
· Prioritizes innovations on the MAP data platform as business needs evolve.
· Sets standards for data quality, validation and house holding rules.
· Provides Corporate Marketing representation on the Enteprise Data Governance Council.

Performance Reporting

· Define strategic and tactical performance reporting standards for marketing and sales lead campaigns.
· Set expectations with internal stakeholders for critical success factors for campaigns and interprets the results of performance reports for those stakeholders.
· Define the roadmaps for recurring campaigns, starting with fundamental capabilities in the initial rounds of campaign maturity, and leading to more nuanced results supporting test and learn goals as campaigns become more mature.
· Define the short and long-term test and learn strategy for Corporate Marketing and incorporates test and learn capabilities into the majority of campaigns.
· Automate and streamline the production of reports so that low-value activities require the absolute minimum of DSO team people-time. 

Other

· Mentor, teach and coach DSO team members in the skills, processes and knowledge needed to execute their jobs at a successful level of competence, and steadily increases these levels of competence over time.
· Represents the DSO team in Corporate Marketing planning, strategy, idea creation, execution and tracking activities.
· Sets targets for DSO team performance and quality, monitors DSA team member performance in comparison with those standards, and establishes learning objectives to close the gap between performance and expectations.is not provided for this position.

Relocation
Relocation assistance available
Travel:
Less than 10% travel required of this position.
Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science with an emphasis in quantitative and predictive analytics, or has sufficient and relevant professional experience in the workplace to have developed the equivalent training.
* 5 years' experience in management of analytics processes and capabilities for the marketing function within a medium to large corporate enterprise, with emphasis on team leadership, developing business relationships with internal stakeholders, hitting deadlines, coordinating the roles of multiple internal and external contributors towards complex and ongoing projects.
* 3 years of experience executing Marketing campaigns on Salesforce Marketing Cloud
* 3 years' experience working in direct marketing campaign design, execution and tracking in the consumer and/or business marketing domain with emphasis on email, call center, branch/storefront and web media vehicles.
* 3 years' experience working in an analytics role within a financial services company focused on retail and/or business banking, including product knowledge of deposits, lending, credit, payments, treasury and wealth management.

Job Description:
Job Description
Technology and Engineering Collective (TEC) Program Lead
 
Comerica's Technology and Engineering Collective (TEC) program is a two-year assignment rotation program designed to provide recent College graduates accelerated training in Information Technology. This role will also be responsible for our Technology Internship program.
The TEC Program Lead will be responsible for aligning the program with our strategic direction, participant development, on-boarding, budgeting, program branding and community involvement. Partnering with our Human Resources and Talent Acquisition team members to attract colleagues is also a critical piece of the role.
 
COMPETENCIES
Successful incumbents possess strong time management and organization skills; great communication and interpersonal skills; critical thinking, problem solving and analysis skills; have ability to perform project and program management.
 
Responsibilities:
Project Execution

Manages projects small/medium size projects of moderate complexity.
Responsible for on-time delivery and execution of critical Technology projects and initiatives to deliver business value.
Works with core project team (such as business partners, vendors and technical team) to develop detailed, actionable project schedules. Assigns tasks to team and develops detailed and accurate work schedules, project estimates, and resource plans.
Executes, monitors and controls technical projects from original concept through final implementation.
Communicates accurate and timely project accomplishments and overall project health to stakeholders via required measures and methods (such as status reports, metrics, checkpoints, portfolio reports, and scorecards).
Manages and monitors project budgets with high focus on approved technical funding and technical cost containment. Ensures cost changes have accurate and timely approvals and follow corporate and department standards, policies and procedures.
Reviews project deliverables, especially technical artifacts. 
Manages technical vendor team, and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables. 
Ensures support areas are engaged to drive effective training and turnover of technical solutions.
Resource Planning
· Staffs technical projects through initial resource planning and ongoing accurate labor forecasting. Ensures the right teams are engaged at the right time for the right work over the life of the project.
· Ensures accurate and timely resource time charges to assigned projects.
· Coordinates contingent labor procurement/selection as required for assigned projects.
Risk Management

Ensures adherence to all government, corporate and department standards, policies and procedures in all technical artifacts, tasks and decisions across the technical team. 
Works to ensure all artifacts adhere to all standards, policies and procedures.
Proactively manages project risks and risk mitigation plans.
TravelTravel is not required of this position.
 
Relocation
Relocation assistance is not available.
