Job Title: Commercial Underwriter for Technology Life Sciences
Job Description:
Job Description
The Commercial Underwriter is responsible for underwriting and documentation of basic and less complex loan requests for assigned Lines of Business (LOBs) as well as owning deal analyses and execution of workflows according to established Service Level Agreements (SLAs), also responsible for assisting in the on-going monitoring of the credit exposure for assigned relationships, including renewals, reaffirmations and annual risk ratings.
Reporting Information:The Commercial Underwriter reports to the Manager Commercial Underwriting (MCU).
Position Competencies:Successful incumbents possess strong analytical, time management, verbal and written communication skills, are accountable and have strong data management capabilities.
Position Responsibilities:
1. Provide complete analysis of loan package for new deals, reviews and renewals

Prepares and/or updates appropriate RECAP documentation with guidance from MCU (Manager Credit Underwriting).
Prepares basic collateral charts, cash flows, risk ratings and other attachments.
Provides basic industry analysis.
Identifies policy exceptions and works with MCU/RM (Relationship Manager) to mitigate them.
Identifies and analyzes inconsistencies and inaccuracies in customer data, including spreads, aging's, projections and other financial documents.
Develops basic analytical narrative and commentary on the request.
Evaluates strengths and weaknesses of the credit and escalates risks and other issues to MCU and/or RM or PM (Portfolio Manager).
Assists RM/PM with contacting customers to obtain answers for loan analyses and recommend loan structures and covenants.
Prepares risk rating with guidance from MCU.
2. Administration

Monitors loan covenants and tracking on simple transactions in conjunction with CSC (Credit Support Center) support team for assigned relationships.
Shares responsibility with Credit Specialists for performing OFAC checks and identifying issues.
Investigates title searches, surveys and UCC (Uniform Commercial Code) searches as requested by MCU or RM/PM.
3. Process Sustainability

Adheres to department procedures for workload management.
Strives to meet or exceed SLA, or when not possible, communicate to MCU and RM/PM.
Ensures appropriate RECAP formats/attachments are used in accordance with approved process & procedures.
Other duties as assigned.
TravelTravel is not required of this position.
RelocationRelocation is not available for this position.
Work ScheduleThis positions work schedule may require overtime.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree
Two (2) Accounting courses (minimum 6 units)
1 year Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Business or Accounting
Strong academic track record:
3.0 cumulative GPA,
3.0 GPA average in the two (2) accounting courses
Demonstrated leadership and strong verbal and written communication skills
Work Schedule
8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Comerica West Headquarters

Job Title: Domain Architect  Core Payments  Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description

The Solution Architect leads the solution design of medium to large sized projects and programs, from ideation through implementation. They work closely with Agile Delivery Teams, business partners, IT stakeholders and Enterprise Architecture to ensure potential solutions align with established technology directions and standards while meeting business needs. They create and communicate key project architecture artifacts that represent the overall solution in the areas of Infrastructure, Application, Integration and Data Architectures. They have a breath of technology knowledge and are avid learners of both the business and technology. They are also able to tailor their communication level to the appropriate levels of the organization and will manage deliverables on several portfolio projects concurrently. They will also mentor and guide other Solution Architects.
Position Competencies
Successful candidates will possess strong communication skills, comfort around higher management, command skills, creativity and a strong technical acumen. They will also have political savvy and strategic agility, the ability to work with and direct peers, and are avid learners of Comerica's Businesses and what makes them successful. Must be able to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations. They are also able to take strong positions, communicate and defend, when called to make difficult decisions. Experience with financial systems (preferably payment systems) and knowledge of government or compliance standards (e.g. SWIFT CSP, PCI, and AIBE) be helpful.
Experience with commercial banking technologies and portal platforms is desired.
Position Responsibilities
1. Leads the solution design of several medium to large sized projects of moderate complexity, providing a baseline set of design artifacts for use by developer and engineers during construction.
2. Ensures solution designs align with our Enterprise Architecture Principles, Patterns, IT Standards and Strategies.
3. Ensures all viable options are objectively considered and appropriately balances the business goals with technical architecture, and project constraints.
4. Communicate how the overall solution meets the business requirements.
5. Provide input into estimating processes to establish project funding.
6. Ensures all solutions drive simplification and standardization through the effective use of design patterns and reuse of technology.
7. Effectively work with internal technical teams as well as outside vendors to determine appropriate solution architectures and implementation models.
8. Designs solutions that effectively meet the performance, extensibility, integration, capacity, and accessibility needs of applications.
9. Ensures designs appropriately meet our Technical Minimal Security Baseline standards (TMSBs) and align our enterprise standards and principles.
10. Actively participates in defining the short and long term architecture strategy for key business segments, focusing on cross project needs and future business direction.
11. Leads in the development of architectural design patterns.
12. Leads the development, implementation, communication, and on-going support of solution architecture processes and standards.
13. Active participant in the promotion and continued enhancement of our Enterprise Architecture practice and governance.
14. Review and provide expert knowledge to other Architect roles.
 
Total Rewards
We know that our employees are critical to our overall success. We are dedicated to investing in their future to maintain long-term relationships for lasting commitments. One of the ways we do this is to offer a comprehensive package of compensation and benefits programs which are regularly reviewed to maintain them at competitive levels. Your salary will be commensurate with your work experience.
Travel
Local travel is required of this position up to 10% of time
 
 
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university and 10 years of technical experience or High School Diploma or GED and 14 years of experience
10 years IT project experience with small to medium sized projects.
10 years of experience in identifying multiple technical solutions for business problems, identifying the benefits and risks of the solutions, and providing recommendations.
10 years of experience with enterprise architecture and a contributor of its direction.
8 years of experience with multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments.
5 years of experience with the enterprise's inter-departmental relationships.
7 years of experience with the development and use of architectural patterns.
7 years of experience at creating architectural diagrams targeted to varying audiences.
7 years of experience in translating business needs into solution architecture requirements.
7 years of experience with business process re-engineering principles and processes.
8 years of experience with Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.
5 years of experience in estimating the financial impact of solution architecture alternatives.

Job Title: Trading and Portfolio Management Systems Specialist
Job Description:
Job Description
Trading Platform Systems Specialist
Position Summary
As a member of the Command Center, this role is responsible for middle and back office functions relating to Comerica WM portfolios on the Envestnet platform. Team members will also be responsible for maintaining accounts within their risk region, transitioning portfolios and reporting compliance exceptions to the Group head. This position will report directly to the Group Head of Command Center. The Sr. Analysts as a team will have responsibility for approximately 4000 existing accounts which are to be transitioned to Preferred Portfolios in addition to a growing account base. The Risk Trading team members will be in Michigan.
 
Responsibilities:

Execute client directed trades and bond trades for investment management accounts on Envestnet.
For accounts not suited to Tax Overlay Services, manage transition process via model update, out of non-approved products and replace with approved products in line with Comerica Guidelines.
Set up automatic annual rebalance on all accounts
Provide reports on IP Exceptions to appropriate parties
Weekly basis: review with Group Head those IP Violations that Command is tasked to remediate
Ensure that appropriate parties are receiving Envestnet or other reports 

Monitor trading files for mutual funds, collective funds and equities daily. Address issues with Envestnet and/or Fiduciary Services & Operations to ensure correction prior to end of business day.
Cover Command Center and Account Opening mailboxes.
Complete tasks noted in Critical Items file daily to ensure execution and prevent trade errors.
Work with IT and vendors to determine and implement effective solutions to system issues.
First responder to questions from Investment Professionals and Envestnet.
Provides support to Envestnet and IT on a variety of production related issues. Collects and analyzes data to identify/evaluate operational issues and makes recommendations to solve problems
Participate in system tests/validations to ensure that the external customers will experience minimal impact.

Weekly review and remediation of risk variance exceptions
Review and rebalance CIO directed asset allocation changes

Notify IS on action taken to remediate exceptions
Review any unapproved exceptions with Group Head

Work with Compliance to facilitate exception reporting
Maintain up to date knowledge of Comerica WM investment management approach, process, asset allocation guidelines, risk regions and approved (and no longer approved) strategies and products.
No travel is required
No relocation assistance is provided
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance
2 years experience with back/middle office trading and portfolio management systems
1 year experience working with Envestnet, ComTRAC, or other trading, portfolio management or trust systems

8:00am- 5:00pm Monday-Friday

Comerica Bank Center

Job Description
Retail Personal Banker I
We invite you to explore the award-winning culture, people, rewards and opportunities that make Comerica Bank so special. Make your next career choice a confident one. The Retail Personal Banker (RPB) is responsible for contributing to the overall success of a Retail Banking Center by committing to banker-readiness, conducting marketing activities leading to revenue growth in loans, deposits and noninterest income, contributing to the prescribed customer experience levels, maintaining disciplined operational objectives, while striving for excellence in execution in each of the mentioned areas. This position's work schedule involves occasional evenings and Saturdays and requires the lifting and movement of currency/coin packages weighing up to 25 pounds.
Position Competencies
Successful incumbents have composure, listening skills, a drive for results, time management, are customer focused, and have the ability to develop peer relationships.Responsibilities
Marketing Activities:* Executes the proactive marketing activities for the attraction, retention and expansion of customers.* Completes assigned Daily Planning activities.* Provides effective New Customer Onboarding and Customer Engagement by, in part, routinely strengthening new customer relationships, introducing new and existing customers to Comerica's product and services, addressing customer questions, e.g., how-to use products and services and follows-up on a timely basis. * Participates in the acquisition of consumer and business clients through the effective use of targeted leads, self- sourcing new business, managing referral source relationships. * Supports Portfolio Management efforts to retain, expand and increase the number of portfolio customers in the Banking Center.* Impact the revenue growth of the Banking Center.* Other duties as assigned.

 Customer Experience Management: * Able to assess needs and add value to customers and prospects.* Educate and fulfill customer requests, routine and complex.* Resolve customer complaints.* Maintain and add value to deepen existing relationships.* Provide transactional customer service, including but not limited to the following: Accept and process deposits, withdrawals and payments and handle other over the counter and mail transactions, as needed.* Impacts the customer experience by following defined customer experience guidelines and other customer experience behaviors and feedback as needed.* Other duties as assigned.
Partnership:* Impact the efforts that support Banking Center Collaboration.* Develop a relationship with the partner to support business development.* Identify opportunities to add value to customers by introducing them to partners.* Other duties as assigned.

TravelTravel is not required of this position.

Job Title: Sr Product Analyst  Business Analyst   Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description

The Sr. Product Analyst is responsible for serving as a liaison between the business and technology. They collect, analyze, develop, document, communicate business requirements, and support user testing to achieve business goals. Continually seek opportunities to increase client satisfaction, deepen relationships, and effectively manage client expectations.
 
Delivery Excellence* Provides strategic management of the overall Product program, ensuring that release schedules are met and risks managed * Leads a collaborative, dynamic Product planning process prioritizing efforts that align with Comerica and Technology strategies and provide the best value and outcome for the investment* With the delivery team, responsible for developing structured development plans that drive Product releases from inception through delivery * Works with the Program/Project Management to decompose the Product Vision and Product Roadmap into themes which will be captured in the Product Backlog by the project manager or delivery lead * Working with the technical teams and the business Product Owner, the Product Delivery Manager is responsible for driving a Release and Iteration Plan based on the Backlog* Consistently exercise independent judgment and discretion in matters of budget, scope and schedules
 
Strategic Thinking* Works with stakeholders to expand product offeringso Monitor current market, and competitive trends to identify opportunities for growtho Support new product ideation activities and processeso Collaborates with Marketing and the business Product Owner on overall product strategyo Maintain awareness of Technology strategies and direction to assure the alignment of the product's technologies o Coordinate new product offerings and oversee flow of set up processes within delivery teams* Drives appropriate level of development and operational support throughout a product's phases in the maturity life cycle: introduction, growth, maturity, decline * Develops strategic relationships with suppliers adhering to the tenants of the Corporate Supplier Relationship Management program
 
Collaboration* Works with the key stakeholders including the business Product Owner to define the Product Vision and Product Roadmap for any given product that considers innovation, customer feedback and market/industry drivers* Works in collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams including security, risk/compliance, architecture and operations* Ensures that all team members, including business partners, are working together effectively, are communicating with related teams and are producing quality work, in line with the overall Product vision* Actively participates in the Product Development community, sharing and re-applying skills and knowledge and bringing in best practice* Maintains communication with stakeholders in Technology and other lines of business to ensure that there is visibility into the Product's direction, schedule, progress and operational status o Key stakeholders are dependent on the Products produced, they must have regular and useful updates to allow them to plan their business activities* Communicates the Product Vision to interested parties and stakeholders. It is important that the businesses understand the solution and can engage to ensure there is successful delivery* Communicates with the technical delivery teams to ensure that they understand what is required of them

1 year of experience reviewing numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the
1 year of experience presenting findings, or translating data into an understandable document

Job Description:
Job Description

 
Principal Project Manager  The Principal Project Manager role will be responsible for all aspects of the development and implementation of assigned projects and provide a single point of contact for those projects within the Hogan Deposits space. This role will provide technical and analytical guidance to project team. This role will also recommend and act to direct the analysis and solutions of problems.  COMPETENCIES Successful incumbents possess strong time management and organization skills; great communication and interpersonal skills; critical thinking, problem solving and analysis skills; have ability to perform project and program management.
Responsibilities: Project Execution * Manages large projects/programs of high complexity. * Responsible for on-time delivery and execution of critical Technology projects and initiatives to deliver business value. * Works with core project team (such as business partners, vendors and technical team) to develop detailed, actionable project schedules. Assigns tasks to team and develops detailed and accurate work schedules, project estimates, and resource plans. * Executes, monitors and controls technical projects from original concept through final implementation. * Communicates accurate and timely project accomplishments and overall project health to stakeholders via required measures and methods (such as status reports, metrics, checkpoints, portfolio reports, and scorecards). * Manages and monitors project budgets with high focus on approved technical funding and technical cost containment. Ensures cost changes have accurate and timely approvals and follow corporate and department standards, policies and procedures. * Reviews project deliverables, especially technical artifacts.  * Manages technical vendor team, and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables.  * Ensures support areas are engaged to drive effective training and turnover of technical solutions. Resource Planning * Staffs technical projects through initial resource planning and ongoing accurate labor forecasting. Ensures the right teams are engaged at the right time for the right work over the life of the project. * Ensures accurate and timely resource time charges to assigned projects. * Coordinates contingent labor procurement/selection as required for assigned projects. Risk Management * Ensures adherence to all government, corporate and department standards, policies and procedures in all technical artifacts, tasks and decisions across the technical team.  * Works to ensure all artifacts adhere to all standards, policies and procedures. * Proactively manages project risks and risk mitigation plans.
Travel Travel is not required of this position.

Job Title: VP, Sr. Technology / Banking Services Sourcing Manager - Auburn Hills, MI
Job Description:
Job Description

Sr. Technology / Banking Services Sourcing Manager
This position is responsible for building strong relationships with their business partners and driving the successful enterprise-wide sourcing, category management and contract execution and delivery of Technology and Banking Services related spend categories, delivering the best value to the corporation while building and sustaining mutually beneficial relationships with suppliers. Provide subject matter expertise and strategic guidance within the supplier sourcing and purchasing areas; develop and instill appropriate sourcing and purchasing process and procedures, as well as ensuring compliance with the overall program; influence and support business owners and other groups across the Bank; lead cross-functional teams in support of the Strategic Sourcing programs; and responsible for all aspects of the development and implementation of the various category spend management across the Bank.
 
Position Responsibilities:

· Oversees the execution of Strategic Sourcing and Procurement initiatives for Technology and Banking Services related spend categories ranging from $45 - $100 million annually.
· Provide subject matter expertise on all facets of sourcing including, alternative arrangements, recommended supplier(s), process, and methodology.
· Lead and effectively influence clients through business case development, the optimal sourcing strategy and approach, evaluate strategically aligned sourcing opportunities and any related impact(s), risks, compliance issues and/or regulatory impacts that may arise from such business arrangements.
· Develop integrated (strategic and tactical) category sourcing strategy that will deliver strongest business value, and drives category transformation; responsible for tracking and reporting of spend and benefit (value/savings)
· Manage ongoing category management/planning (strategy management) activities including driving supplier performance, demand management savings and increasing category compliance. 
· Communicate, negotiate and manage relationships with clients and suppliers through all levels of organization, including being the primary interface to legal. Senior Management communication and interface required.
· Responsible for managing Supplier Lifecycle activities for assigned categories, which includes Opportunity Assessment, Sourcing, Contracting and related Supplier Due Diligence activities;
· Ensures consistent and repeatable execution of the sourcing process; Leverage data analytics to identify, evaluate and prioritize opportunities in support of specific strategic and business objectives; Present analysis around cost savings opportunities to Senior Management for consideration.
· Lead and/or provide guidance to resources supporting the execution of the Sourcing and Contract processes.
 
TravelLocal travel is required of this position.
 

Relocation:Relocation assistance may be available.
Qualifications

· Bachelor's degree from an accredited university; Banking/Financial Services experience preferred
· CPSM, CPTE / CTPS, aCOP, and/or COP certification preferred
· E-Procurement experience preferred; SAP Ariba or similar 
· 6 years or more experience with high level administrative and service-delivery methodologies and practices
· 6 years of direct management experience
· 6 years of experience with budgetary responsibility
· 6 years of experience in financial analysis, business case development and developing position papers.

Job Title: Credit Support Center Lead, San Jose
Job Description:
Job Description
Credit Support Center Lead
The Credit Support Center (CSC) Lead is responsible for supporting complex credit approval actions for supported lines of Business including RECAP preparation, RECAP attachments and other supporting documents as requested. The CSC Lead is also responsible for daily workflow assignments and prioritization for all lines of business supported to ensure service levels and customer needs are being met, while escalating issues to the CSC Manager. In addition, the CSC Lead is responsible for reviewing work of junior team members to ensure appropriate quality is delivered.
Position Competencies
Successful incumbents have the ability to represent the team perspective on various projects; adapts quickly to a changing work environment; is skilled in learning new processes while assisting with implementation across the CSC team; possesses a strong knowledge of accounting procedures and principles and exhibits independent decision-making skills; possesses a strong ability to assess procedures and recommend process improvements.
Responsibilities:
Workload/Training & Quality Support

Assists CSC Manager with onboarding and training for new hires, and ongoing training of existing team members.
Identifies gaps in training while escalating to CSC Manager.
Assists with the monthly RRR process and identifies workload items while interacting with the CSC, Portfolio, and Relationship Managers.
Delegates workload items to CSS team when manager is not available.
Attends workload meetings to ensure deadlines are met, and reviews other team members work to ensure quality.
Completes monthly Risk Rating Input Quality Tests.
Ensures that policies, procedures, and practices are adhered to and escalates inconsistencies to CSC Manager.

RECAP Preparation

Independent preparation of intermediate RECAPs and attachments for more complex credits at the request of the UWC.
Prepares non-complex Annual Risk Rating reviews.
Orders personal credit reports and other required due diligence reports while identifying any issues/concerns to the UWC, RM/PM and or CSC Manager.

Reporting

Verifies reports for accuracy while consolidating and compiling various reports for the respective CSC Team.
Oversees financial statement spreading and tracking to ensure quality and service levels are met.
Spreads complex financial statements and identifies any inconsistencies and inaccuracies.
Assists CSC Manager to ensure that statement tracking systems are accurate and updated on a timely basis in accordance with prescribed Service Level Agreements.
Monitors financial covenant tracking system to ensure accurate and timely compliance monitoring.
Ensures that proper identification and placement of all financial documents has been made by CSC team members into the Electronic Credit file.

Other Duties

Strives to meet or exceed Service Level Agreements and communicates to CSC manager when not feasible.
Other duties as requested by CSC Manager.

RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position.TravelTravel is not required for this position.
 
Qualifications
* High School Diploma or equivalent (GED) and 2 college level accounting classes (6 units, 2.0 GPA) OR High School Diploma or equivalent (GED) and 2 years of experience in loan documentation, lending support or other banking position* 2 years Credit, Training or Management experience* 1 year of Credit Support Specialist experience* 1 year of utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Word
Work Schedule
8:30am -5:00pm Monday - Friday, occasional overtime may be required
Work Location(s)
Comerica West Headquarters

Job Title: Commercial Underwriting Officer for Technology & Life Sciences, San Jose
Job Description:
Job Description
Commercial Underwriting Officer, Technology and Life Sciences
The Commercial Underwriting Officer is responsible for the underwriting and documentation of larger and/or more complex loan requests for assigned Lines of Business (LOBs), underwriting a variety of loan types and structures and may have expertise in one or more LOBs, owns deal analyses and executes workflow according to established Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Also assists in the on-going monitoring of the credit exposure for assigned relationships, including renewals, reaffirmations and annual risk ratings.
Reporting Information:The Commercial Underwriter Officer reports to the Manager Commercial Underwriting (MCU).
Position Competencies:Successful incumbents possess strong analytical, time management and verbal and written communication skills.
Position Responsibilities:
1. Provide complete analysis of loan package for new deals, reviews and renewals

Independently prepares and/or updates appropriate RECAP documentation for large and/or complex requests.
Prepares collateral charts, cash flows, risk ratings and other attachments.
Provides detailed industry analysis and understand potential impacts on the client and credit request.
Identifies policy exceptions and independently develop mitigates and structure modifications to address or eliminate them.
Identifies and analyzes inconsistencies and inaccuracies in customer data, including spreads, aging's, projections and other financial documents.
Ensures complete and thorough analytical narrative and commentary on the request and makes recommendations on structural enhancements to mitigate risk or help win business.
Evaluates strengths and weaknesses within each credit and escalates risks and other issues to MCU and/or RM or PM (Portfolio Manager).
Independently contacts customers to obtain answers for credit requests.
Recommends appropriate controls and covenant structure for new credit requests.
Recommends risk rating.

2. Administration

Calculates loan covenants and assist with tracking on complex transactions in conjunction with CSC (Credit Support Center) team for assigned relationships. Follows-up with PM/RM on violations and provide recommendation for waiver, modification or cure.
Shares responsibility with Credit Specialists for performing OFAC checks and identifying issues.
Serves as mentor and assists with training more junior underwriters and rotating credit analysts.
Investigates title searches, surveys and UCC (Uniform Commercial Code) searches as requested by MCU or RM/PM. Works with PM and loan closing team as requested to resolve issues.

3. Process Sustainability

Adheres to department procedures for workload management.
Strives to meet or exceed SLA, or when not possible, communicate to MCU and RM/PM.
Ensures appropriate RECAP formats/attachments are used in accordance with approved process & procedures and assists MCU with reviewing RECAPs.
Recommends process improvements in support if continuous improvement culture within Commercial Underwriting.
Other duties as assigned.

TravelTravel is not required of this position.
RelocationRelocation is not available for this position.
Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree
4 years of commercial underwriting, credit and/or lending experience
Completion of Credit College or other formal credit training
5 years' experience with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)


Work Schedule
8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday
Work Location(s)
Comerica West Headquarters

Job Title: Principal Engineer   Informatica Administrator  Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description

 
Principal Engineer
The Principal Engineer role will provide engineering and architecture support for complex system management activities related to system software, hardware, performance, problem determination or resource management requiring communication and coordination with vendors, technicians, clients, and management. It will provide technical input to management decision making in the area of software, hardware, and performance. Its responsibilities include: defining networking requirements; performing detailed analysis of various projects and requests; developing designs for projects that have medium to high complexity; formulating procedures; monitoring key performance indicators; and implementing advanced business solutions. This role may also integrate solutions or build via DevOps depending on the maturity of the organization and/or product.
Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents have excellent customer service skills, have strong inter-personal and communication skills, strong attention to detail, drive for results, decision quality, dealing with ambiguity, and ability to multi-task and have strong organizational skills.
Responsibilities:Design & Methodology 
* Investigate & propose a strategic fit solution across server platform infrastructures. 
* Work closely with Business Units, Application teams, infrastructure areas & Vendors to identity, review & evaluate the solution requirements. 
* Investigate & propose strategic fits for Virtualization, Consolidation & Rationalization solution opportunities within the infrastructure or business. Propose changes to the technical architecture & design solutions as applicable. 
* Review & provide recommendation/input if/as applicable on new technologies/roadmap/presentations and Vendor product offerings specific to "System" Server, System Software technologies & Solutions & products.
* Review & Identify Outsourcing Opportunities (e.g. ASP, IAAS, SAAS) 
* Evaluate & align strategic fit solutions across infrastructure platforms & solutions specific to "System" hardware & software technologies.
* Understand, participate, review & influence long term capacity planning & technology investments.
Technical Consulting 
* Provide Client consulting & planning guidance as applicable for moderate to large highly complex projects/programs.
* Provide consultation & works closely with other functional infrastructure areas/departments on multiple initiatives to meet common organizational / business goals & objectives.
* Participate in and provides consulting & planning guidance on short term & long term planning in order to meet ongoing business & operational needs. 
* Participate in and provides consulting to project teams on architectural, design development, integration opportunities, planning of highly complex systems & assures it is aligned to our established strategies, guiding principles, rationales & practices. 
* Develop & provide estimates for projects/programs & initiatives during consulting, planning & implementation review if/as applicable for projects & initiatives.
Planning & Organizing
* Identify & evaluate projects/programs/initiatives & design processes that enhance & rationalize existing and upcoming solutions.
* Map requirements into standard services solution, identity opportunities for integrating to existing or reuse technology & provide cost effective solutions for moderate to large highly complex project/programs/initiatives.
* Review and propose alternate solutions to non-standard solutions if/as applicable to meet business & applications needs.
* Review, identify & manage requirements for moderate to complex solutions and do a cost value, feasibility and risk analysis as appropriate.
* Assist & provide guidance on complex/ large project/program planning phases & process. Direct and/or indirect management responsibility for large to enterprise size projects /programs/initiatives/services with high complexity across multiple functional area(s).
Risk Management 
* Participate in CAB/ECAB and active assess risk of proposed changes.
* Review, participate, develop (if/as applicable) & update architectural standards, guiding principles, rationales & strategies.
* Evaluate, review & approve highly complex design solutions for business & Infrastructure project or programs or initiatives.
Administration 
* Keep management informed of status of on activities through accurate, timely, and appropriate reporting. 
* Actively participates in committees representing the department and/or planning unit.
* Keep abreast of leading edge technologies in engineering space.
* Estimating cost saving targets.
* Budget low cost hosting provider Relocation assistance is not provided for this position.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or High School Diploma or GED and 9 years of technology experience
8 years Technology project management experience complex, critical projects
8 years in identifying technical solutions for complex business problems, identifying the benefits and risks of the solutions and providing recommendations
8 years negotiating complex solutions
8 years designing complex solutions
5 years of mentoring another technologists
4 years of experience working with Informatica and IBM CDC.
4 years of experience administrating and running informatica servers.
4 years of experience administrating and running IBM CDC servers.
2 years of experience with ETL flows interacting with the source system technical staff, the project database administrator (DBA) and the DI Administrator to develop and document the most efficient method to extract source data.
2 years of experience with IBM CDC flows interacting with the source system technical staff and project database administrator (DBA).

8am to 5pm

Job Title: Corporate Real Estate Senior Counsel
Job Description:
Job Description

SENIOR COUNSEL -- CORPORATE REAL ESTATE 
 
Company
Comerica Incorporated is a financial services company headquartered in Dallas, Texas, strategically aligned into three major business segments: Business Bank, Retail Bank, and Wealth Management. Comerica Bank locations can be found in Arizona, California, Florida, Michigan and Texas, with select businesses operating in several other states, as well as Canada and Mexico.
 Position Description
Comerica Bank's has an open Senior Counsel position for an experienced and highly motivated commercial real estate and business transactions lawyer. The attorney will work at the bank's headquarters in Dallas, Texas as part of a team of attorneys and will provide the primary legal support for Comerica's enterprise corporate real estate matters. This Senior Counsel will have primary responsibility for handling matters related to company owned real estate, including purchases, sales, transfers, easements, OREO, etc. as well as drafting and negotiating the bank's commercial leases (including leases for Comerica Bank's banking centers, services centers and other location where the Bank is landlord or tenant). In addition, the position provides secondary support for matters related to the bank's commercial lending businesses, Special Asset Group, special projects and other areas of the bank as needed. Although litigation, regulatory and/or compliance experience is a plus, this is not a litigation, regulatory or compliance position.
Position Competencies
This Senior Counsel position requires the highest level of legal analysis, integrity, trust and judgment. The successful attorney must have excellent oral and written communication skills, superb people skills, the ability to learn new areas of law quickly, business acumen, political savvy, an ability to anticipate and meet the needs of a demanding client group, flexibility and the ability to juggle a wide range of assignments simultaneously.
 Responsibilities 
· Draft and negotiate various commercial leases, lease amendments, purchase and sale agreements and letters of intent for commercial properties owned or leased by the bank
· Serve on due diligence team related to corporate owned real estate and facilities acquisition matters
· Advise on new law implementations
· Advise on landlord-tenant issues, as well as other real estate matters including zoning, eminent domain, and other real estate legal issues
· Assist with the filing of regulatory applications, forms, etc. related to corporate owned and leased real estate
· Advise business unit executives and other staff on facilities matters
· Monitor the emerging legal-regulatory issues and Other Real Estate Owned (OREO) properties, and associated regulatory filings
· Provide legal support to various management committees
· Serve as a subject matter expert regarding facilities and corporate owned real estate matters, and provide support to other Corporate Legal Department colleagues regarding such matters
· Work closely with business teams to manage legal and contractual compliance for all Comerica properties, including permits, licenses, approvals, insurance, inspection and other legal requirements (e.g., zoning variances, building codes, ADA, etc.)
· Provide advice with respect to broker services
· Manage and review reports and other due diligence materials related to potential title and environmental liabilities
· Handle disputes with landlords, contractors, tenants and/or subtenants
· Provide legal support to the Office of Risk Management and Office of Enterprise Wide Compliance department staff regarding legal, compliance and other issues associated with real estate appraisal laws and regulations as well as Other Real Estate Owned (OREO) properties
· Advise senior bank officers, Relationship Managers and support personnel regarding the legal implications of proposed Bank policies, courses of action, credit policy and management decisions.
· Train and counsel bank personnel on legal, regulatory and compliance matters that affect the industry, company and their respective lines of business.
· Monitor company and industry issues and work with the business lines to implement and adhere to federal and state legal and regulatory requirements
· Assist the Special Assets Group and their Senior Counsel with acquisitions and dispositions of special asset properties, deeds-in-lieu of foreclosure, commercial mortgage foreclosures, foreclosures of security interests in various types of collateral such as inventory, accounts receivable and equipment.
· Assign, manage and monitor matters assigned to outside counsel.
· Other duties as necessary or assigned to facilitate the bank's legal needs and accomplish its business goals
 
Travel
Less than 5% travel is required of this position.
 Location
This position is located in Dallas, Texas and reports to the Senior Vice President and Divisional General Counsel
Relocation
Relocation assistance is not provided for this position.

Qualifications


· Attorney must be licensed to practice law and a member in good standing in Texas; or admitted to practice and a member in good standing of another U.S. bar association (preferably California, Michigan or Florida), otherwise in compliance with the in-house counsel registration rules of Texas, and willing to become admitted to the Texas bar within 180 days of employment.
· Minimum of seven (7) years of experience either with a U.S. law firm and/or in-house legal department with at least 5 years of relevant commercial real estate transactions and leasing experience
· Experience negotiating and drafting leases, purchase and sale agreements, letters of intent and other real estate related documents
· Experience reviewing and opining on easement, title, environmental, insurance, brokerage and related real estate matters.
· Experience with commercial lending and other types of business transactions is a plus
· General familiarity with laws and regulations pertaining to real estate and business transactions
· Excellent legal skills and judgment including ability to interpret and explain statutes and regulations
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills
· Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, time management and organizational skills
· Ability to understand and be responsive to the business's needs and partner across control functions throughout the organization to achieve commercials results while mitigating risk
· Adaptable, flexible and willingness to continue formal and informal learning and development
· Ability to work independently and as part of a team, manage complex projects and multitask successfully in fast-paced and changing business environment

Enterprise Cloud Applications Architect performs the necessary leadership, facilitation, analysis and design tasks related to the development of seamless customer centric solutions, especially for Retail Banking customers focusing on cross channel, integrated functions, single view of customer leveraging leading CRM platforms like Salesforce, advanced customer interaction mechanisms such as chatbot, natural language processing, voice biometrics etc. and API-based integration with core banking systems.

Innovation

EA Governance

Facilitate and develop architectural standards for cloud related technologies
Facilitate the development and evolution of the architecture and global governance processes
Define and facilitate the process for approving architecture principles and standards
Mentor IS team members in the principles of Enterprise Architecture
Develop, collect and analyze Enterprise Architecture metrics to identify continual improvement opportunities

Other

Experience with contact center technologies such as IVR, Chatbots, Natural Language Processing, Voice Biometrics is highly preferred
Any prior experience working with SaaS based CRM platforms such as Salesforce, Sugar CRM, MS Dynamics is highly preferred

Job Title: Enterprise Architect   Auburn Hills
Job Description:
Job Description
We invite you to explore the award-winning culture, people, rewards and opportunities that make Comerica Bank so special. Make your next career choice a confident one.
Enterprise Cloud Applications Architect performs the necessary leadership, facilitation, analysis and design tasks related to the development and cloud migration of high performance, mission critical applications with high availability and disaster recovery mechanisms. Deep experience with Payments related vendor platforms including core banking systems is required. Must have demonstrated experience architecting and developing applications for Wire, Check, ACH and Card payment channels. Experience with Real Time Payments and integration is highly desirable. Highly proficient in API based integration patterns and DevOps practices for development and deployment.
Applications are expected to be developed as cloud native applications on Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure. Defines, designs and delivers cloud architecture for enterprise applications hosted or built natively on the cloud and integrating with on-premises systems.
Responsibilities:
Innovation

Collaborate with the application, data, and infrastructure architects on defining, designing and delivering cloud specific technical architectures, patterns, technical quality, risks and operability of cloud architecture solutions for cloud native applications and cloud migrated applications.
Create the conceptual, logical and physical design for cloud-based solutions for infrastructure and platforms
Research, analyze, recommend and select technical approaches to address challenging development and integration problems with cloud environments.
Perform research activities to identify emerging technologies and trends that may affect the enterprise
Maintain awareness of vendor/product industry developments, regulations and trends and identify potential impacts to the enterprise
Assist in vendor/product selection activities including the development of vendor/product evaluation models used in Requests for Proposal (RFP's)
Design and oversee efforts in building effective bank specific Proof of Concept demonstrations and socialize the results throughout the enterprise and all levels of management
Provide technical/business consulting to internal IS organizations and client-sponsored activities outside of IS

Strategy

Provide leadership and direction for defining application specific cloud strategy aligned with business domain priorities
Analyze the business drivers that determine key architecture requirements for various cloud service delivery models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS etc.) along with cloud specific services such as Amazon SQS, Lambda, RDS etc.
Develop the process for creating a technical strategy that supports the business strategy and facilitate its development, and maintenance.

EA Governance

Perform technical architecture planning activities for cloud initiatives
Facilitate and develop architectural standards for cloud related technologies
Facilitate the development and evolution of the architecture and global governance processes
Define and facilitate the process for approving architecture principles and standards
Mentor IS team members in the principles of Enterprise Architecture
Develop, collect and analyze Enterprise Architecture metrics to identify continual improvement opportunities

Relocation
Relocation assistance is available
 
Travel
Travel up to 20% may be required of this position
Qualifications

Bachelor Degree and 10 years of experience in technology or High School Diploma or GED and 14 years of experience in technology
5 years of experience leading complex enterprise teams through business process integrations, converting business strategy into action oriented objectives and measurable results
1 year of experience with a focus on customer centric services & offerings
1 year of experience leading design and architecture for seamless, cross channel solutions that invoke and process payments.
1 year of experience architecting integration with core banking systems.
1 year of experience of experience working with Fintechs (e.g. FIS, Fiserv, Backbase, Bottomline etc.)
1 year of experience Architecting single sign on authentication and authorization solutions for customer facing applications.
1 year of hands-on experience with Serverless functions and computing paradigms (e.g. AWS Lambda).
1 year of experience in microservices architecture and containerization
1 year of experience with Cloud identity federation for applications
1 year of experience with DevOps practices in app development - AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, CodePipeline etc.
1 year of experience with Messaging architecture for cloud native applications using AWS SQS and SNS, Azure Service Bus
8 years of experience in relationship skills with clients, peers, multiple levels with management, and suppliers
3 years of experience with infrastructure, system and application design using web, mobile, cloud, and open source technologies
3 years of experience with various enterprise solutions/ technology stacks (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS) and providing guidance to diverse stakeholders and external vendors
1 year experience Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure cloud solution, architecture, related technologies and their interdependencies
5 years of experience as an Architect with specialization in at least one technology domain (e.g. cloud computing, data management, integration, security, infrastructure, CRM, BPM etc.)

8am to 5pm
